meanings.definition: A thick, solid piece of something
meanings.sent1: She bit into a juicy chunk of watermelon.
meanings.sent2: He ate a big chunk of the cake.
meanings.sent3: The chunk of cheese was so big, it could feed an army!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a chunk of sunshine in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chunk of ice was as cold as a winter night.

meanings.definition: A large amount or portion of something
meanings.sent1: He received a substantial chunk of the inheritance.
meanings.sent2: A good chunk of the day was spent cleaning the house.
meanings.sent3: The chunk of time they spent together felt like a dream.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up a chunk of the room.
meanings.sent5: The chunk of information was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: To break or divide into chunks
meanings.sent1: She tried to chunk the wood with an axe.
meanings.sent2: He chunked the chocolate bar into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent3: The chef chunked the vegetables quickly for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent4: The hammer seemed to chunk the rock effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The machine chunked the ice into perfect cubes.
